description:
100% Open Source Toolkit for Large Language Models: Train, Tune, Chat on your own Machine

Transformer Lab is a free, open-source LLM workspace that you can run on your own computer. It is designed to go beyond what most modern open LLM applications allow. Using Transformer Lab you can easily finetune, evaluate, export and test LLMs across different inference engines and platforms.
What's Changed
- Fixed experiment creation before experiments are loaded bug by @ParamThakkar123 in https://github.com/transformerlab/transformerlab-app/pull/1109
- Changed path where controller.log is saved by @ParamThakkar123 in https://github.com/transformerlab/transformerlab-app/pull/1110
- Add VSCode interactive support by @deep1401 in https://github.com/transformerlab/transformerlab-app/pull/1074
- Add parameterization and sweeps by @deep1401 in https://github.com/transformerlab/transformerlab-app/pull/1081
- Pin numba and remove --upgrade flag from uv pip install by @deep1401 in https://github.com/transformerlab/transformerlab-app/pull/1113
- One liner: Add check for providers array before using .map() by @dadmobile in https://github.com/transformerlab/transformerlab-app/pull/1108
- Remove librosa from main pyproject.toml and add it to plugin specific setup files by @deep1401 in https://github.com/transformerlab/transformerlab-app/pull/1114
- Add GCS as option for fsspec by @dadmobile in https://github.com/transformerlab/transformerlab-app/pull/1091
- Change date on deprecation announcement by @deep1401 in https://github.com/transformerlab/transformerlab-app/pull/1115
Full Changelog: https://github.com/transformerlab/transformerlab-app/compare/v0.27.4...v0.27.5
